ming, that the oldest inhabitants Of this
place had ever witnessed. 1t was indeed the

scene.

clamorous for the sacrifice. The medicine

and after some fleurishes, said he could SO

The captive was then led into the council

dible expressions of grief, but after she was
appr'zrd OF the interposition in her favor, her

present could speak her language, and all

On Sunday night last about 10, we had
one of the most terrific storms, accompanied
by uninterrupted and vivid blaaes Of light
ming, that the oldest inhabitants Of this
place had ever witnessed. 1t was indeed the
most awful display of divine power we
have ever beheld. Many, to .void the dan
ger OF being buried under their houses, de-
serted them-the stoutest was appalled,,
and an idea prevailed that the great day OF
reckoning was at hand; we have much rea.
son to be thankful that no serious injury oc-
CARED. A very large barn, close by town,
the property of Mrs. Long, was set on fire
by the lightning Its tremendous blaze,
amidst the bowling of the wind and torrents
OF rain, added to the dismal grandeur of the
scene.

at Portland. Maine, was recently tried for
au assault on woman. The presiding

quashcd, when the trial was partly over, on
the ground that the disgrace of any trial
was Sufficient punishment for the offence
